changestmt.respstmt: Editors: Morris Eaves, University of Rochester; Robert Essick, University of California, Riverside; and Joseph Viscomi, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill Assistant Editor: Michael Fox Managing Editor: Joseph Fletcher Assistant Project Manager: Grant Glass Project Coordinator, University of Rochester: Eric Loy Consultants on Special Projects: Ashley Reed, Josh Romphf, Alex Zawacki Bibliographer: Chuck Ripley Project Assistants: Natasha Bharucha, Katherine Calvin, Kendall DeBoer, Ani Govjian, Meaghan Green, Rachael Isom, Mary Learner, Rob Rich, Madeline Rose, Anneke Schwob, Oishani Sengupta, Elizabeth Shand, Kate Soules, Iftekhar Uddin, Marcie Woehl

objinfo.medium: Pencil, pen and ink, with touches of gray wash
objinfo.framelines: 1A single framing line in pen and ink extends around the design.

provenance.name: National Gallery of Art, Washington, D. C.
provenance.note: Probably acquired my later than 1827 by Thomas Butts from Blake or no later than 1831 from Blake's wife Catherine; history unknown until acquisition at an unknown time by Marsden J. Perry; sold by Perry in 1908 to William A. White; sold through the dealer A. S. W. Rosenbach to Lessing J. Rosenwald on 1 May 1929; given by Rosenwald to the National Gallery of Art, Washington, D. C. in 1943.

repository.institution: National Gallery of Art, Washington, D. C.

objnote.p: Butlin 644, *The Last Judgment* in the Harry Ransom Center, University of Texas, Austin, Texas, may be a preliminary drawing for this more finished work.
